Title: Roundcube: Multiple Vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Roundcube allowing
    remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code, inject arbitrary web
    scripts, and perform cross-site scripting (XSS).

Background.Text: Free and open source webmail software for the masses, written in PHP.

Description.Text: Remote authenticated users with certain permissions can read arbitrary files or possibly execute arbitrary code via .. in the _skin parameter to index.php. Additionally, a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in program/js/app.js allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the file name in a drag-n-drop file upload.

Impact.Text: A remote authenticated user could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML, read arbitrary files, or perform XSS.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Roundcube users should upgrade to the latest version:
